data.text: Need a Lightweight Comfortable Saddle for a Gravel Bike
Recommendations for a lightweight, comfortable saddle below 100 dollars for a gravel bike? The one that came with my Topstone is awful.
Very personal. What has worked for you in the past? Brooks get a lot of recommendations and I have liked my 2
data.author: Alan Cole

data.text: Honestly, I've never been too picky. My other uprights I've ridden in the past have had okay enough seats, so this is the first time I've ever been in the market for a new one.
data.author: Richard J. Auchus

data.text:
this is the specific one I got, but I think you can‚Äôt go wrong with Brooks. B17 Honey Bike Saddle https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000HZA91S?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share

data.text: Depends on what works with your anatomy, but if Charge Spoon works for you, I can highly recommend them, put them on all my bikes.

data.text: Brooks C17 is pretty good I find.

data.text: I love it, but it's neither lightweight nor cheap

data.text: but it‚Äôs comfy and you can pick one up within budget if you look around. Is weight such an issue when your bike is loaded up anyway?

data.text: I paid 92$ for a Brooks C19 a month ago.
data.author: Douglas Miner

data.text: Agree, my topstone saddle was garbage. Switched to a brooks B17 and now I don‚Äôt even wear padded shorts!
data.author: Adam Mertz

data.text: I like Ergon saddles. I think the cutout is a great feature. I've got the carbon model which is really lightweight but the cheaper ones are also fine.
data.author: Matthias Matze

data.text: I like Selle SMP and Selle Italia.
data.author: Paul M. Ross

data.text: WTB Pure
data.author: Mauricio Montejano

data.text: Many bike shops have a saddle library where you give a deposit to try several different saddles, a few days or weeks at a time. The deposit applies to your purchase.
data.author: Tom Cavan

data.text: Vincent Wheels I have at least 4 shops ( one has 3 locations) near me with this service. Brooks, Selle, Terry, Ergon and others offered.
data.author: Tom Cavan

data.text: WTB Volt
data.author: Tony Dangerfield

data.text: used brooks
data.author: Lucas Ehster

data.text: Brooks Cambium C15 (140mm width) or C17 (165mm) . Durable & waterproof. It's like riding a hammock. However, I'd avoid the 'carved' model as it would occasionally snag the jewels whilst shifting around
data.author: John Stokes Jr

data.text: mine started squeeking after one year. Pretty annoying
data.author: Dries Taillieu

data.text: wow. totally annoying, for sure. going on 3yrs now with mine w/ no noise.
data.author: John Stokes Jr

data.text: Lightweight and comfortable AND under 100? Nah bruh. Stop being cheap. Spend just a lil more money and get a good saddle like the specialized power.
data.author: Trey Freeman

data.text: Such a personal choice. Hubby and I have 6 ergon saddles though. Fits us great.
data.author: Brandi Jackson Hodges

data.text: Ergon
data.author: Darrell Richard

data.text: On Wish you can get a plastic spider web seat that is light, practically indestructable, weatherproof and very comfortable for under $10. Ive been using them for a few years and love them.
data.author: Malcolm Doreian

data.text: Before you worry about which saddle to get, go get sized. If you get the ‚Äúbest‚Äù saddle and it‚Äôs the wrong size, it will still quite literally be a pain in the ass!

data.text: Topstone - B17‚Ä¶ all day long!

data.text: Brooks cambium solved my sit bone problem.

data.text: Saddle is the one place I recommend spending what ever it takes to be great (under $200). Find a local retailer that allows test rides or saddle swap service. I have gone threw 30+ Different saddles to find my magic

data.author: Richard J. Auchus

data.text: I have a LOT of saddles. Like a bin of 20 or so I‚Äôve tried and hated. The only one that comes to fitting this criteria for me is the Charge Spoon. The Fabric Scoop is solid too, although twice the price. Of course, we‚Äôre talking saddles, so it goes without saying that this is what works for me and your mileage may vary. Good luck!
data.author: Scott Bakker
